main event: A ground-radar observation was reported by a civilian in Madras, Oregon on 17 August 1958. The sighting lasted for 2 minutes and involved the observation of a single object moving in a southwest direction, leaving a bright trail and fading away.
interesting points: The observation was made using ground-radar by a civilian source.
The object was seen leaving a bright trail and fading while moving southwest after a large explosion.
The conclusion stated that the earth was passing through periodic meteoric showers, suggesting a prosaic explanation for the sighting.
Three civilians reported the sighting to a Redmond city patrolman, who then reported it to the ACTS operator at Redmond, Oregon.
The report was supported by clear visibility and calm weather conditions in the area.
sighted object: single object leaving a bright trail
witnesses: civilian source, three civilians, Redmond city patrolman, ACTS operator
